subject: RE: [junit] fundamental questions on JUnit
msgSnippet: It s not just knowing that the road was traveled, but that it was well traveled. So maybe the debugger will never lose its place. ... Anil ... ===== for good
messageBody:
It's not just knowing that the road was traveled, but
that it was well traveled.
So maybe the debugger will never lose its place.
---
Anil

> They need to be different if you need to know which
> path the code took
> and if there's no other way to know. However, do
> you really need to know
> which path the code took?
>
> Isn't it sufficient to test that you get the correct
> return value for
> whatever combinations of input values you choose to
> test with?
>
> Daniel
>
>


=====
